meanings.definition: A selection from the books of the Prophets read in synagogue as part of Jewish worship.
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi read the haftorah aloud.
meanings.sent2: The haftorah reading followed the Torah portion.
meanings.sent3: The haftorah made the congregation smile with its ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed through the synagogue like a haftorah.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the haftorah lingered in their hearts.

meanings.definition: The portion of scripture read after the Torah reading in a Jewish religious service.
meanings.sent1: After the Torah reading, it was time for the haftorah.
meanings.sent2: People listened attentively to the haftorah being chanted.
meanings.sent3: The haftorah seemed to whisper secrets to those who listened closely.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed smoothly like a well-rehearsed haftorah.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the haftorah reading filled the room with reverence.
